Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance | LLM Engineer | Brussels, Belgium




We are working with a machinery company focused on integrating advanced AI technologies. They are seeking a skilled LLM Engineer to join their team and help build and maintain language model pipelines.




Job Description

Large Language Model (LLM) Engineer to design, implement, and optimize training and evolution pipelines for large-scale language models. The ideal candidate will have experience in data management and cleaning, strong Python programming skills, and the ability to document code thoroughly. A research background or experience working with academic or industrial research projects will be a strong advantage.




Key Responsibilities

Develop, deploy, and maintain training and evolution pipelines for LLMs.
Manage and clean large datasets to ensure high-quality input for model training.
Write clean, modular, and well-documented Python code.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate LLM capabilities into machinery applications.
Continuously monitor and optimize model performance and pipeline efficiency.
Maintain thorough documentation for reproducibility and knowledge sharing.
Stay updated with the latest research and advancements in LLMs and NLP.




Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
Proven experience working with large language models and machine learning pipelines.
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
Strong skills in data cleaning, preprocessing, and management.
Research background or experience in NLP/LLM research is a plus.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
[In order to requisition 1968]

Join Our Generative AI Technical Group at Tweag the OSPO of Modus Create!

We are looking for an AI Engineer to join our Generative AI technical group, where we combine engineering agility with deep expertise and a scientific approach to advance the state of how AI is used, provide actionable practical insights, and establish best practices in the field.

About You

Previously, you worked as an AI engineer, data engineer or software developer, with a couple of AI or data-centric projects under the hood. Perhaps you have been relying on previous academic experience in a quantitative field for autonomous, deep-dive work for that, but no matter how, you absorb quickly and enthusiastically. Since The Hype started, you have successfully designed and implemented applications using Generative AI.

Now that you know how to build stuff, you realized that there are wrong turns commonly taken in the community, whether imposed by tooling or by culture. As an engineer, you want to make the AI world a better place for not only developers, but also maintainers, product owners, and end users.

If you recognize yourself in parts of the above, the Generative AI group at Tweag, the OSPO of Modus Create, wants you to help us advance the way how AI technologies are used in the field. By building well-written open source tools and libraries, freely and happily sharing knowledge internally, on our technical blog, and during conferences, and consulting clients on how to build better with AI, you and the whole team can make a real difference: let's look behind all the buzz and make sure things are done right‚Ñ¢!

Technologies and Tools


Python programming language and its popular numeric and data frameworks
Familiarity with an LLM framework (e.g. LangChain) and evaluation libraries
Cloud AI services: experience with some of SageMaker, Bedrock, Rekognition, etc. or equivalents on other platforms
Data storage and querying: SQL and NoSQL databases


Bonus points for


Comfortable with Git, GitHub/GitLab and CI/CD
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with other languages like Java, Scala, Rust, or R
Knowledge of cloud architecture, DevOps, or front-end development
Experience with processing / orchestration tools such as Airflow, Spark, Kafka, Nextflow, etc.
Contributions to open source projects
Academic background


Team Culture:

At Modus, a fast-growing, remote-first company, you'll experience various exciting projects! Here's a taste of what you might do:


Giving back: Be an active participant through opportunities such as blog posts, open source contributions, and event speaking.
Travel & connections: Meet fantastic people during our remote meet-ups! It's all about collaboration and fun! Global environment and diversity at its best.
Teaching and learning: Work in active teams on internal and external projects, staying up-to-date with the latest technologies.
Being a self starter: Autonomy and proactivity are the key to succeed at Modus.
Client interaction: Represent Modus and our values while connecting directly with our clients, some of the world's biggest brands.
Growth: Enjoy comprehensive learning benefits, with access to over 12,000 courses. Your growth is our priority!


About us:

Founded in 2011, Modus is a global, fully remote team of world-class technologists who thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment. We were fully remote before it was cool! We support organizations on their digital transformation journey through strategic consulting and full lifecycle product development, partnering with industry leaders including Atlassian, GitHub and AWS. Recognized as one of the Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies for nine years and a top remote work company by FlexJobs, we have helped some of the world's largest brands deliver powerful digital experiences.

We combine boutique expertise with enterprise-scale capabilities. As an award-winning Atlassian partner with a world-class team, we help organizations innovate and solve complex challenges for Fortune 500 companies and beyond, we want to hear from you.

Perks of working with us:


Remote work with flexible working hours
Modus Global Office Programme:for when you want to get out of your home, we offer on-demand access to private offices, meeting rooms, coworking spaces and business lounges in locations in over 120 countries.
Employee Referral Program
Client Referral Program
Travel according to client or team needs
The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
Access to more than 12,000 courses with a licensed Coursera account.
Possibility to obtain paid certification/courses if they align with company goals and are relevant to the employee's role


By joining our team, you'll be part of a winning squad that plays to each other's strengths and celebrates every success together. Apply now and show us you've got what it takes to take your consulting skills to the next level with Modus Create!
